title: Recognize Dehydration Symptoms
brief: Identify progressive dehydration symptoms to take action before it becomes life-threatening.
steps: Step 1: Watch for early signs: dark urine with strong odor, low urine output, fatigue.
Step 2: Check for moderate symptoms: dark sunken eyes, loss of skin elasticity, emotional instability.
Step 3: Test skin elasticity by pinching skin - slow return indicates dehydration.
Step 4: Check for delayed capillary refill in fingernail beds (press nail, release, time return to pink).
Step 5: Look for advanced signs: trench line down center of tongue, extreme thirst.
Step 6: Remember that thirst appears when you're already 2% dehydrated.
warnings: 5% fluid loss causes weakness and nausea; 10% causes inability to walk; 15% can cause death.
Don't wait for thirst - it's not an accurate indicator of hydration needs.
